Class.name: BasicQueryable
Class.Description: Provides a set of **static** methods for querying data structures that implement `IQueryable`.
Class.Remarks: The purpose of this class is to mimic several basic methods implemented by the standard `System.Linq.IQueryable<T>`, but that work with `IQueryable`.

Method.name: Take
Method.Description: Returns a specified number of contiguous elements from the start of a sequence.
Method.Remarks:
`Take` enumerates *source* and *yields* elements until *count* elements have been yielded or *source* contains no more elements.
If *count* is less than or equal to zero, *source* is not enumerated and an empty `IQueryable` is returned.
Method.ReturnDescription: A `IQueryable` that contains the specified number of elements from the start of `source`.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: The sequence to return elements from.

Argument.name: count
Argument.Description: The number of elements to return.

Example.HeaderRemarks: The following code example demonstrates how to use `Take(IQueryable, Int32)` to return elements from the start of a sequence.

Method.name: Skip
Method.Description: Bypasses a specified number of elements in a sequence and then returns the remaining elements.
Method.ReturnDescription: A `IQueryable` that contains elements that occur after the specified index in the input sequence.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: The sequence to return elements from.

Argument.name: count
Argument.Description: The number of elements to skip before returning the remaining elements.

Example.HeaderRemarks: The following code example demonstrates how to use `Skip(IQueryable, Int32)` to skip a specified number of elements in a sorted array and return the remaining elements.

Method.name: Reverse
Method.Description: Inverts the order of the elements in a sequence.
Method.ReturnDescription: A `IQueryable` whose elements correspond to those of the input sequence in reverse order.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: A sequence of values to reverse.

Example.HeaderRemarks: The following code example demonstrates how to use `Reverse(IQueryable)` to reverse the order of elements in an array.

Method.name: Any
Method.Description: Determines whether a sequence contains any elements.
Method.ReturnDescription: `true` if the source sequence contains any elements; otherwise, `false`.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: A sequence to check for being empty.

Example.HeaderRemarks: The following code example demonstrates how to use `Any(IQueryable)` to determine whether a sequence contains any elements.

Method.name: Sum
Method.Description: Computes the sum of a sequence of numeric values.
Method.ReturnDescription: The sum of the values in the sequence.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: A sequence of numeric values to calculate the sum of.

Method.name: Count
Method.Description: Returns the number of elements in a sequence.
Method.ReturnDescription: The number of elements in the input sequence.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: The `IQueryable` that contains the elements to be counted.

Example.HeaderRemarks: The following code example demonstrates how to use `Count(IQueryable)` to count the elements in a sequence.

Method.Description: Returns the only element of a sequence, and throws an exception if there is not exactly one element in the sequence.
Method.ReturnDescription: The single element of the input sequence.

Argument.name: source
Argument.Description: A `IQueryable` to return the single element of.
